content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Accessibility Tree with numerical label representing information about the page, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
4) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {Accessibility Tree of a web page}

Now given a task: Find a Coursera course on Sustainable Agriculture practices, and detail the course's objectives and the background of the lead instructor.  Please interact with https://www.coursera.org/ and get the answer.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to search for course. Click Search icon to open search box.  
Action: Click [304]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Search field is focused; need to type search query to find courses.  
Action: Type [2333]; Sustainable agriculture practices
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Open the course “Sustainable Agricultural Land Management” to view objectives and instructor details.  
Action: Click [3600]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to view course objectives and instructor background, likely further down the page. Scroll window downward.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to see course objectives and instructor background; likely further down. Scroll window down.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need instructor background; click the instructor link.  
Action: Click [5533]

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Instructor information likely located further down the course page; need to scroll further to reach “Instructor” or similar section.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to locate course objectives, likely higher on page near “What you will learn” or “About this Course”. Scroll up to find that section.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; up
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to reach top “About this Course” section; scroll higher.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; up
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need course objectives near top (“What you will learn”). Scroll further up.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; up
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Clicking the “About” link should jump to the course‑description section where objectives are usually listed.  
Action: Click [5468]

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to locate course objectives; likely below hero; scroll slightly downward to reveal “What you will learn” section.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I’m currently midway in the page (seeing “8 modules” and section headings). The “What you will learn” / course‑objective bullets are normally higher, just above these details. I should scroll a bit upward to reach that objectives section.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; up
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The instructor link (George J. Hochmuth, Ph.D.) is visible; opening it should provide background info.  
Action: Click [5533]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Instructor background info captured on this page. Next, need the course objectives from the course page—return to previous page.
Action: GoBack
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Objectives section (“What you will learn”) likely below current headings; scroll down to reveal.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to reach the “What you will learn” or similar objectives section; continue scrolling downward.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to locate the “What you will learn” section containing course objectives; it should be above current modules section. Scroll upward to find it.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; up
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to reach the section (just above modules) where the instructor link “George J. Hochmuth, Ph.D.” resides so I can reopen it and extract objective bullets that are near that area.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; up
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I need to locate the course‑objective bullet list, often headed by “What you will learn” or similar, which should lie below the hero/ratings section but above the large marketing banner; I must scroll a bit downward to bring that into view.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to locate “What you will learn” section which may be farther down; continue scrolling down a bit to see if objectives appear.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The “What you will learn” (course objectives) section should be just above the “Details to know” heading; I must scroll slightly upward to reach it.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; up
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to reach the very top hero area, where a “What you will learn” bullet list normally appears.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; up
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The hero info is in view (course title & instructor). The course‑objective bullet list (“What you will learn”) is likely just below this hero area but above the Details to know section—so I should scroll a bit downward to bring that into view.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The course objectives are likely present slightly above the current “Details to know” section (often under a heading like “What you will learn”), so I should keep scrolling upward just a bit to reveal that list.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; up
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The “What you’ll learn” / course‑objectives section likely sits further down below this hero and initial details (before or after “Earn a career certificate”). I need to continue scrolling downward to uncover that descriptive block.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: We still haven’t reached the lower parts of the page (after the module list) where “About this Course” or a description with the objective bullets often appears. Continue scrolling downward past the module list.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down

Observation: please analyze the accessibility tree and give the Thought and Action.

Thought: The “About” or detailed course description for objectives is likely below the full module list. I should continue scrolling downward past all modules to reach that section.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
